member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationObjectBase
member.summary: Base class behaviour for all Adventure Game objects.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationObjectBase.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the Conversation object.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationObjectBase.ConversationPreprocessScript
member.summary: Script to run before the Conversation is processed by a command.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier for the Adventure Game object.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.Name
member.summary: Unique name for the Adventure Game object.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.Category
member.summary: Adventure object category, for example Room.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.Descriptions
member.summary: List of all possible descriptions for the object that can be used depending on state.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.CurrentDescription
member.summary: Gets/sets the current description for the object, always defaults to first item in the Descriptions list. If ShowRandomDescription is True a random description is picked everytime. Otherwise the CurrentDescriptionIndex is used to pick this description.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.CurrentDescriptionIndex
member.summary: Gets/sets the current description index. If this is out of range of the Descriptions array an errors is thrown when the description is accessed. It defaults to 0 which will pick the first description in the list.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.PreProcessScript
member.summary: Script to run before the object is processed by a command.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.IsValid
member.summary: Flag that can be used by scripts to determine if the object is valid. This allows objects to be created on the fly to represent entities that are typed in as text but do not exist in the game.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.ShowRandomDescription
member.summary: If set to true, randomizes the display of the Description property, a new random Description is picked on every display.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.WordThatMatchedThis
member.summary: This is a convenience property, it is used in partial word matches to track the original word that was used. For example if an Object Lamp was matched with three letters LAM, then this property will contain this.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.#ctor
member.summary: Default public constructor.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.AdventureObjectBase.ToString
member.summary: Base implementation of all Adventure Objects for ToString
member.returns: The name of the Adventure game object.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Conversation
member.summary: Represents an entire conversation tree between an NPC and a player

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Conversation.Name
member.summary: Unique name for the conversation.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Conversation.ConversationText
member.summary: The initial dialog that the NPC will say when prompted by a command. May be null and the conversation will end

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Conversation.EscapeText
member.summary: If specified the player can bail out of the conversation at any point. If omitted the player cannot leave the script until a natural termination.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationResponse
member.summary: Represents a line of dialog dialog by the player in the conversation tree.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationResponse.ConversationText
member.summary: NPC's response to this dialog, may be null and the conversation ends.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationResponse.Response
member.summary: Actual line of dialog picked by the player

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationResponse.SortOrder
member.summary: Order that the response will be diplayed on the screen. Default is 0, if omitted responses will be sorted alphabetically.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationStage
member.summary: Defines a conversation stage.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationStage.Start
member.summary: Start of the conversation.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationStage.NpcSpeaks
member.summary: Npc is about to speak.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationStage.PlayerResponds
member.summary: Player is about to respond.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationText
member.summary: Represents a line of dialog spoken by an NPC in a conversation tree.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationText.ConversationResponses
member.summary: Possible dialog responses the player can speak in response to the NPC speaking. May be empty and the conversation ends.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ConversationText.Text
member.summary: The actual dialog of the NPC.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Direction
member.summary: Defines a movement direction, for example North.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Direction.Abbreviation
member.summary: Abbreviation for the direction.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Direction.Text
member.summary: Full text for the direction.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameStateEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments for the GameStateEventChanged event delegate. This is fired at

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameStateEventArgs.State
member.summary: Current state of the game when the event was raised.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameStateEventArgs.CurrentLocation
member.summary: The Player's current location in the game, when the event was raised, if appropriate.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameStateEventArgs.Description
member.summary: Provides more information on the state change that just happened if appropriate

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameStateEventArgs.ToString
member.summary: Returns a description of the state change that just occurred
member.returns: String containing diagnostic information.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc
member.summary: Represents a Non-player character that can be manipulated and interacted with.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc.AutoFollow
member.summary: If set to true, this NPC will always go to the same room as the player.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc.Conversations
member.summary: List of possible conversations that this NPC can have, use in conjunction with CurrentConversation to set the interaction that can be had with the NPC.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc.CurrentConversation
member.summary: Currently selected conversation for the NPC. May be null if the NPC does not speak.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc.SetCurrentConversation(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current conversation that will be triggered when interacting with this NPC.
member.param: Name of the conversation.
member.returns: The Conversation object representing the current conversation.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.Npc.GetCurrentConversation
member.summary: Retrieves the current Conversation object.
member.returns: The Conversation object representing the current conversation.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand
member.summary: Represents an adventure command that has been parsed from player input text.

member.summary: Indicates if the command is valid

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.ErrorMessage
member.summary: If command is not valid indicates the error message.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.ParsedCommand
member.summary: The command that was parsed as a GameWord.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters passed to the command.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.CommandMapping
member.summary: The adventure game command that has been identified as being related to the text input by the player.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.GetCommandAndParameters
member.summary: Retrieves the command itself and its parameters as a single list.
member.returns: A list containing the command itself and its parameters.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.GetParametersWithoutStopWords(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Retrieves the list of the command parameters filtering out stop words.
member.param: Optional list of words to filter by. Can be null or a list of strings. Any value in this list will also be excluded from the returned list.
member.returns: A list of parameters without stop words.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.GetOriginalWordsWithoutStopWords
member.summary: Retrieves the list of the original words sent as command parameters filtering out stop words.
member.returns: A list of original words without stop words.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.GetOriginalWords
member.summary: Retrieves the list of the original words sent as command parameters.
member.returns: A list of the originalWords.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.GetWords
member.summary: Retrieves the list of the words sent as command parameters.
member.returns: A list of the originalWords.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.JoinCommandAndParameters
member.summary: Retrieves the command itself and its parameters as a single space delimited string.
member.returns: String containing the command and parameters.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.JoinOriginalWordAndParameters
member.summary: Retrieves the command itself and its parameters as a single space delimited string..
member.returns: String containing the original word and parameters.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.ParsedAdventureCommand.JoinParameters
member.summary: Retrieves the command parameters as a single space delimited string..
member.returns: String containing the command parameters.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData
member.summary: Stores all mutable data for the current game.

member.summary: Flag that is true on first pass through the game loop and false all other times.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.Introduction
member.summary: The game Introduction.

member.summary: The players score at any given point.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.MaximumScore
member.summary: The maxiumum score a player can reach.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.StopWords
member.summary: Sorted List of noise words currently in use in the game.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.InventorySize
member.summary: Current size of the inventory.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.CommandMappings
member.summary: List of Command Mappings used in the game.

member.summary: Stores a list of user-defined variables

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData.DirectionMappings

member.summary: Text to be displayed for the Command Prompt.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject.GetCurrentLocation(AdventureLandCore.Domain.Room)
member.summary: Returns the PlaceableObject's current location, taking in to account whether it is a container, in a room or held by the player
member.param: Supplies the current room, this is passed in in case the object is held.
member.returns: The location (Room) of the object.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject.GetIsVisibleFromOutside
member.summary: Determines if the current object is visible from the outside. Rules are different for items in rooms or items in containers
member.returns: True if visible, false otherwise.

member.summary: Game is initialising variables and state.

member.summary: All scripts are compiled.

member.summary: Player has asked to quit the game.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameState.Won
member.summary: Player has won the game.

Value to replace
New value
StringComparison enumeration that defines the comparison type.

member.summary: Ensure all lines breaks are replaces with single \n character.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi
member.summary: This interface defines the Api (Applications Programming Interface) that can be used by scripts to access the game engine and perform operations on players, rooms and placeable objects. All access to the api for the currently running game is through the variable AWApi available to Python and C# scripts.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetAllContainers
member.summary: Get all containers in the game.
member.returns: A list of containers.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetAllNpcs
member.summary: Get all Npcs in the game.
member.returns: A list of Npcs.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetAllAutoFollowNpcs
member.summary: Get all Npcs in the game that are set to AutoFollow.
member.returns: A list of Auto Follow Npcs.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetAllPlaceableObjects
member.summary: Get all Placeable objects in the game.
member.returns: A list of Placeable objects.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.IsDebugEnabled
member.summary: Retrieves a flag that determines if debug mode has been enabled in the game. This flag is used in scripts to determine whether debug commands should be enabled.
member.returns: IsDebugEnabled flag is returned.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetMoveLimits
member.summary: Retrieves all the possible directions that can be used in a move, full text and abbreviations.
member.returns: List of all directions that can be moved to.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetDirectionFromAbbreviation(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a the direction for the specified abbreviation.
member.returns: The full text name of the abbreviation, or null if it does not exist..

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.Configuration
member.summary: Original configuration information that was used to load the current game. Similar to GameData but has some other useful static information not saved in GameData as it is not required for save games.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetAllAdventureObjects
member.summary: Retrieves a list of all adventure objects in the game. Rooms, objects (and containers) and Exits.
member.returns: The list of all objects.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetContainerForPlaceableObject(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: Retrieves the container PlaceableObject for the specified one (i.e. its immediate parent)
member.param: PlaceableObject to check.
member.returns: The container object, or null if the object is not in a container.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetChildObjects(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: If the specified object contains things, this command will retrieve them all.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.ListChildObjectDescriptions(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: If the specified object contains things, this command will list their current descriptions. If the object has no children have any, nothing is shown.
member.param: The object to list the descriptions of.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.QuitGame
member.summary: Cause the the current game to be ended.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.InitGameData(AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameData)
member.summary: Replaces the current in-game data structures with those supplied in the parameter. This allows a new game loaded from disk to replace the current one.
member.param: NewGameData object to load

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.SerializeToString
member.summary: Serialises the current game to a string, that can be saved to disk.
member.returns: String containing the current game state.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.DeserializeFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a GameData object from the supplied data. This allows the current game to be loaded from an Xml file on disk.
member.param: Xml data created using the SerializeToString method.
member.returns: A GameData object created from XmlData.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetDefaultHelpText
member.summary: Retrieves the default help text associated with each command that the game recognised.
member.returns: Formatted list of the default help text.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetCurrentLocation
member.summary: Returns the current location of the player.
member.returns: A Room object that represents the players current Location.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.SetCurrentLocation(AdventureLandCore.Domain.Room)
member.summary: Sets the current location of the player. Not that this Api call automatically sets the Visited flag of the last room. to true.
member.param: A Room object that is the new location of the player

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.ShowRoomInformation
member.summary: Helper function that shows information about the current location. If the room is dark, its dark description will be shown. If the ShowItemsInRoom feature toggle is false, then the items will not be listed (also not shown if the room is dark).

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.IsItemAvailableToExamine(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: Determines if the specified item is available to examine. That is it is held by the player or in the current room and is currently visible.
member.param: The game object to check.
member.returns: True is it can be examined, false otherwise.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.CanContinue
member.summary: Property used to control the execution of user scripts. Can be set by any user script to determine if processing should continue after that script.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GameData
member.summary: Top level object that contains all data (flags etc.) relating the the game.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.LastPlayerInput
member.summary: Gets/sets the last sentence input by the player.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.SuppressAutomaticInputProcessing
member.summary: Stops the game engine performing its own language processing on the last input from the user. Call this method in your own processing script if you want to handle all processing yourself. You will have to write all your own commands and perform all parsing as well.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.LastParsedCommand
member.summary: Gets the command that has been parsed by the internal game engine from the text in LastPlayerInput

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.LastExecutedCommand
member.summary: Gets the last command to be executed, useful in pre-process scripts to determine which command caused the script to be executed

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.DoIHaveTheObject(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if the named object is in the players inventory.
member.param: String containing the name of the object.
member.returns: True if the invemtory contains the object, false otherwise.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetInventory
member.summary: Retrieve the current players inventory.
member.returns: A list of PlaceableObjects that the player is holding.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.CurrentInventoryCount
member.summary: Retrieves the count of items in the player's inventory.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.Drop(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: Cause the specified object to be dropped.
member.param: The PlaceableObject to drop.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.ThrowToRoom(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject,System.String)
member.summary: Causes the specified object to be thrown through an exit.
member.param: The PlaceableObject to throw.
The name of the room the exit thrown through leads to

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.Take(AdventureLandCore.Domain.PlaceableObject)
member.summary: Cause the specified object to be taken.
member.param: The PlaceableObject to taken.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetObjectsFromNames(System.Collections.Generic.List{AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameWord},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all Game Objects that match the specified word list. Each word is checked against all possible words and a list returned. Any unmatched words are returned as invalid Game Objects. This also accepts All and Everything to return all items in the room.
member.param: List of GameWords that constitutes the sentence to check.
Allows partial matches if set to anything other than 100. Default is 70.
If True, then All/Everthing refers to held items, otherwise it refers to things that can be seen in the room.
member.returns: A list of Npcs (IsValid = true) and invalid words (IsValid = false and Name set to original word).

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetNpcsFromNames(System.Collections.Generic.List{AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameWord},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all Game Objects that match the specified word list and are NPC's only. Each word is checked against all possible words and a list returned. Any unmatched words are returned as invalid Game Objects. This also accepts All and Everything to return all items in the room.
member.param: List of GameWords that constitutes the sentence to check.
Allows partial matches if set to anything other than 100. Default is 70.
If True, then All/Everthing refers to held items, otherwise it refers to things that can be seen in the room.
member.returns: A list of PlaceableObjects (IsValid = true) and invalid words (IsValid = false and Name set to original word).

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetRoomsFromNames(System.Collections.Generic.List{AdventureLandCore.Domain.GameWord},System.Double)
member.summary: Finds all Rooms that match the specified word list. Each word is checked against all possible words and a list returned. Any unmatched words are returned as invalid Room objects.
member.param: List of GameWords that constitutes the sentence to check.
Allows partial matches if set to anything other than 100. Default is 70.
member.returns: A list of valid rooms (IsValid = true) and invalid words (IsValid = false and Name set to original word).

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IAdventureApi.GetStartRoom

member.returns: A Room object that the game started in.

member.param: Name of the room
Direction to travel
member.returns: An Exit object representing the Exit, this may be null.

member.returns: An Exit object representing the Exit, this may be null.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole
member.summary: This class is used for all interaction with the current Console. Access to this object is via the variable ConsoleApi. This will choose the correct class depending on which Console is being used, for example Command Console or Windows Store application. Some methods may not be appropriate for some Consoles, this will be described in the comments and in the Api documentation.

member.summary: Draws a line across the console screen.

Background color of the text string (optional).

member.summary: Hide the cursor. Applies to: Command Console.

member.param: String containing the full file name.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.TurnLoggingOff
member.summary: Switches off logging of the console. If logging is already on this has no effect.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.Wait(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits for the specified amount of time, or optionally until a key is pressed.
member.param: An integer containing the number of milliseconds to wait.
Boolean value if True, pressing any key will cancel the wait. Default value is false
member.returns: Null if cancelOnKeyPress is false or no key is pressed in the time period. Otherwise the Key code of the key that was pressed. This is converted to a integer as keycodes are different in different consoles. Any script that processes this value will have to allow for this.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.ShowCursor
member.summary: Show the cursor. Applies to: Command Console.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.ScreenWidth

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.CursorLeft
member.summary: Sets the left value (horizontal) of the cursor. Applies to: Command Console.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.CursorTop
member.summary: Sets the top value (vertical) of the cursor. Applies to: Command Console.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.BackgroundColor

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.ForegroundColor

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.Title

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.CoreApi.Interfaces.IConsole.CountDownTimer(System.Double,System.Double,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Action{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Implements an environment specific count-down timer, counts from amount to 0.
member.param: Start time in milliseconds for the count-down timer.
Interval in milliseconds that progress will be reported.
Time when the granularity of reporting will be switched, may be null. Ignored if null.
Small Interval in milliseconds that progress will be reported. Allows timer to speed up when reaching 0. Ignored if null.
Callback function executed every large interval (or smaill interval). Returns a Timespan object representing the remaining time.

The target string

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Services.Helpers.FileHelper.WithEnding(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns with the minimal concatenation of (starting from end) that results in satisfying .EndsWith(ending).
member.example: "hel".WithEnding("llo") returns "hello", which is the result of "hel" + "lo".

member.summary: Deletes a directory and all of its sub directories.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ItemNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can never be null.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ItemCanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can be null.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:AdventureLandCore.Properties.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ValueProviderAttribute
member.summary: For a parameter that is expected to be one of the limited set of values. Specify fields of which type should be used as values for this parameter.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of .

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally (throws or terminates the process).
Value canbenull is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon. There is no notion of order rows, all rows are checked for applicability and applied per each program state tracked by R# analysis.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("=> true, result: notnull; => false, result: null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.MustUseReturnValueAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the return value of method invocation must be used.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.ProvidesContextAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the type member or parameter of some type, that should be used instead of all other ways to get the value that type. This annotation is useful when you have some "context" value evaluated and stored somewhere, meaning that all other ways to get this value must be consolidated with existing one.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.SourceTemplateAttribute
member.summary: An extension method marked with this attribute is processed by ReSharper code completion as a 'Source Template'. When extension method is completed over some expression, it's source code is automatically expanded like a template at call site.
member.remarks: Template method body can contain valid source code and/or special comments starting with '$'. Text inside these comments is added as source code when the template is applied. Template parameters can be used either as additional method parameters or as identifiers wrapped in two '$' signs. Use the attribute to specify macros for parameters.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.MacroAttribute
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro for a parameter of a source template.
member.remarks: You can apply the attribute on the whole method or on any of its additional parameters. The macro expression is defined in the property. When applied on a method, the target template parameter is defined in the property. To apply the macro silently for the parameter, set the property value = -1.

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Properties.MacroAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro that will be executed for a source template parameter when the template is expanded.

members.member:
Allows specifying which occurrence of the target parameter becomes editable when the template is deployed.
If the target parameter is used several times in the template, only one occurrence becomes editable; other occurrences are changed synchronously. To specify the zero-based index of the editable occurrence, use values >= 0. To make the parameter non-editable when the template is expanded, use -1. >

member.name: P:AdventureLandCore.Properties.MacroAttribute.Target
member.summary: Identifies the target parameter of a source template if the is applied on a template method.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcSuppressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcViewComponentAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component name.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcViewComponentViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component view. If applied to a method, the MVC view component view name is default.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String).

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CollectionAccessAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how method, constructor invocation or property access over collection type affects content of the collection.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CollectionAccessType.None
member.summary: Method does not use or modify content of the collection.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CollectionAccessType.Read
member.summary: Method only reads content of the collection but does not modify it.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CollectionAccessType.ModifyExistingContent
member.summary: Method can change content of the collection but does not add new elements.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent
member.summary: Method can add new elements to the collection.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisfies the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to true.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to false.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to null value.

member.name: F:AdventureLandCore.Properties.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.RegexPatternAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that parameter is regular expression pattern.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.NoReorderAttribute
member.summary: Prevents the Member Reordering feature from tossing members of the marked class.
member.remarks: The attribute must be mentioned in your member reordering patterns

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.XamlItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the type that has ItemsSource property and should be treated as ItemsControl-derived type, to enable inner items DataContext type resolve.

member.name: T:AdventureLandCore.Properties.XamlItemBindingOfItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the property of some BindingBase-derived type, that is used to bind some item of ItemsControl-derived type. This annotation will enable the DataContext type resolve for XAML bindings for such properties.
member.remarks: Property should have the tree ancestor of the ItemsControl type or marked with the attribute.
